infotexts.addsubtooltip: Places another submarine into the current submarine file. Can be used for adding things such as smaller vessels, escape pods or detachable sections into the main submarine.
infotexts.holdtolink: Hold space and click with the mouse to link to another item.
infotexts.charactermodetooltip: Allows you to pick up and use items. Useful for things such as placing items inside closets, turning devices on/off and doing the wiring.
infotexts.wiringmodetooltip: Allows you to connect wires between items.
infotexts.generatewaypointstooltip: AI-controlled crew members require waypoints to navigate around the sub.
infotexts.subnamemissingwarning: Name your submarine before saving it.
infotexts.itemassemblynamemissingwarning: Name your item assembly before saving it.
infotexts.itemassemblyfileexistswarning: There's already an item assembly with the same name. Do you want to replace the existing assembly?
infotexts.nohullswarning: No hulls found in the submarine. Hulls determine the "borders" of an individual room and are required for water and air distribution to work correctly.
infotexts.disconnectedventswarning: The submarine contains vents that haven't been linked to an oxygen generator. Select a vent and click an oxygen generator while holding space to link them.
infotexts.disconnectedturretswarning: The submarine contains [itemname]s that haven't been linked to an ammunition loader. Select the item and click a loader while holding space to link them.
infotexts.nowaypointswarning: No waypoints found in the submarine. AI-controlled crew members won't be able to navigate without waypoints.
infotexts.nocargospawnpointwarning: The submarine does not have spawnpoints for cargo (which are used for determining where to place bought items). To fix this, create a new spawnpoint and change its spawn type parameter to "cargo."
infotexts.farawayentitieswarning: One or more structures/items have been placed very far from the submarine. Do you want to move the camera to them?
infotexts.adjustlightsprompt: This submarine was saved using an older version of Barotrauma, which used a different formula to calculate lighting. The lighting in the submarine may now appear too bright. Do you want to automatically readjust the lighting for the new lighting formula?
infotexts.adjustedlightsnotification: The brightness of the lights has been adjusted. Areas with multiple light sources may still appear too bright and require reducing the range or brightness of the lights manually. You may also use the console command "multiplylights" to adjust the brightness of all the lights at once. For example, "multiplylights 1,1,1,0.5" would decrease the brightness by 50%.
infotexts.noballasttagswarning: You should add the tag "ballast" to the ballast pumps to allow AI characters to identify which pumps are used for controlling the buoyancy of the submarine.
infotexts.insufficientfreeconnectionswarning: The module contains a junction box that's been linked to [doorcount] doors but only has [freeconnectioncount] free wire connections available. This may prevent the outpost from being powered properly.
infotexts.nohullnameswarning: No names given to any of the hulls; using auto-generated names. Characters use the names to refer to different rooms when reporting occurrences such as hull breaches.
infotexts.deletingcontainerwithitems:
A container with items inside was deleted—delete contained items as well?

Contained items:
infotexts.manuallyoutfittedtooltip: Does the submarine come with enough manually placed supplies to start with, or does it rely on automatically placed items and/or items transferred with the player?
infotexts.mirrorentityxtooltip: Mirror the entity horizontally. You can also use the shortcut Ctrl + N.
infotexts.mirrorentityytooltip: Mirror the entity vertically. You can also use the shortcut Ctrl + M.
infotexts.nonlinkedgapswarning: The submarine contains gaps that aren't linked to any hulls. Gaps should always overlap with at least one hull (for gaps that lead outside the sub) or two hulls (for gaps between rooms).
infotexts.cannoteditvanillasubs: Cannot edit the submarines defined in the Vanilla content package!
infotexts.subeditor.structurecountwarning: The submarine has a very large number of structures, which may cause performance issues. Consider reducing the number of structures.
infotexts.subeditor.structurecounterror: The submarine has too many structures (>[max]), which will lead to performance issues. Please reduce the number of structures.
infotexts.subeditor.wallcountwarning: The submarine has a very large number of wall pieces with a collider, which may cause performance issues. Consider reducing the number of walls.
infotexts.subeditor.wallcounterror: The submarine has too many wall pieces with a collider (>[max]), which will lead to performance issues. Please reduce the number of wall pieces.
infotexts.subeditor.itemcountwarning: The submarine has a very large number of items, which may cause performance issues. Consider reducing the number of items.
infotexts.subeditor.itemcounterror: The submarine has too many items (>[max]), which will lead to performance issues. Please reduce the number of items.
infotexts.subeditor.lightcountwarning: The submarine has a very large number of light sources, which may cause performance issues. Consider reducing the number of lights.
infotexts.subeditor.lightcounterror: The submarine has too many light sources (>[max]), which will lead to performance issues. Please reduce the number of lights.
infotexts.subeditor.shadowcastinglightcounterror: The submarine has too many shadow-casting light sources (>[max]), which will lead to performance issues. Please reduce the number of lights, or disable shadow-casting on some of the lights.
infotexts.canattachtoprevious.tooltip: Which sides of this module are allowed to attach to the previously placed module. E.g., if you want a module to always attach to the left side of the docking module, you could set this to Right.
infotexts.subeditor.packagealreadyexists: There is already a content package with the name "[name]". Please choose another name or select the package from the list if you want to edit it.
infotexts.subeditor.duplicatesubinpackage: The content package already contains a submarine with the same name. Do you want to overwrite the existing submarine file?
infotexts.stringpropertytranslate: This text will be translated to [translation].
infotexts.stringpropertycannottranslate: This text will not be translated—text with the tag [tag] not found in the language files.
infotexts.charactereditor.selectanchor1pos: Select the anchor position for the joint
infotexts.charactereditor.selectlimbtoconnect: Select another limb to connect it with the joint
infotexts.charactereditor.cantaddjointsnolimbeleme: Cannot add joints, because no limb elements were found!
infotexts.charactereditor.humanoidlimbdeletiondisa: Deleting limbs from a humanoid is currently disabled to prevent crashing
infotexts.charactereditor.copyjointsettingstooltip: Copies the currently tweaked settings to all selected joints.
infotexts.charactereditor.providefilename: Please provide a name for the file
infotexts.charactereditor.recreateragdolltooltip: Many of the parameters require recreating the ragdoll. If adjusting the parameter doesn't seem to have an effect, click this button.
infotexts.charactereditor.copycharactertooltip: Create a copy of the current character
infotexts.charactereditor.holdleftalttoadjustcycle: Hold Left Alt to adjust the cycle speed
infotexts.charactereditor.head: Head
infotexts.charactereditor.holdleftalttomanipulatej: Hold Left Alt to manipulate the other end of the joint
infotexts.charactereditor.texturedoesnotexist: The texture file does not exist!
infotexts.charactereditor.missingtorsoorhead: You need to define at least one limb as Torso or Head!
infotexts.charactereditor.missinglimbtype: You need to define one and only one limb as [limbtype]!
infotexts.charactereditor.failedtoreadhtml: Character Editor Screen: Failed to read HTML at [path]
infotexts.charactereditor.multipleitemswithsamehie: Multiple items with the same hierarchy [hierarchy] found ([name]). Cannot continue.
infotexts.charactereditor.cannoteditvanillacharact: Cannot edit the characters defined in the "Vanilla" content package! You can create a copy of the character (in another content package) should you want to edit it.
infotexts.charactereditor.existingcharacterfoundre: An existing character with the same name was found in the same content package. Do you want to replace it (the original files will be lost)?
infotexts.charactereditor.existingcharacterfoundov: An existing character with the same name was found in another content package. Do you want to create an override of it (the original files will stay intact)?
infotexts.charactereditor.existingcharacterfound: An existing character with the same name was found.
infotexts.charactereditor.drawlimbonspritesheet: Draw the limb on the spritesheet
infotexts.charactereditor.existingjointfound: A joint between limbs [limbid1] and [limbid2] already found!
infotexts.charactereditor.contentpackagenameinuse: A content package with the same name already exists. Please choose another name or select the existing content package from the dropdown if you want to add the character to it.
infotexts.sp.scale.name: Scale
infotexts.sp.spritedepth.name: Sprite Depth
infotexts.sp.disallowedupgrades.name: Disallowed Upgrades
infotexts.sp.hiddeningame.name: Hidden in Game
infotexts.sp.item.hiddeningame.name: Hidden in Game
infotexts.sp.item.noninteractable.name: Non Interactable
infotexts.sp.item.spritecolor.name: Sprite Color
infotexts.sp.item.inventoryiconcolor.name: Inventory Icon Color
infotexts.sp.item.containercolor.name: Container Color
infotexts.sp.item.containercolor.description: Changes the color of this item's container. Only has an effect if either the UseContainedSpriteColor or UseContainedInventoryIconColor property of the container is set to true.
infotexts.sp.item.condition.name: Condition
infotexts.sp.item.tags.name: Tags
infotexts.sp.item.displaysidebysidewhenlinked.name: Display Side by Side When Linked
infotexts.sp.item.displaysidebysidewhenlinked.desc: Enable if you want to display the item HUD side by side with another item's HUD, when linked together. Disclaimer: The HUDs may block each other, if they were not designed to be viewed together!
infotexts.sp.item.spritedepth.name: Sprite Depth
infotexts.sp.item.nonplayerteaminteractable.name: Non-Player Team Interactable
infotexts.sp.item.nonplayerteaminteractable.descri: When enabled, item is interactable only for characters on non-player teams.
infotexts.sp.item.allowswapping.name: Allow Swapping
infotexts.sp.item.allowswapping.description: Can the item be swapped with other items in outposts? Only relevant on swappable items such as turrets.
infotexts.sp.item.invulnerabletodamage.name: Invulnerable to Damage
infotexts.sp.item.invulnerabletodamage.description: When enabled, will prevent the item from taking damage from any source.
infotexts.sp.structure.indestructible.name: Indestructible
infotexts.sp.structure.specialtag.name: Special Tag
infotexts.sp.structure.spritecolor.name: Sprite Color
infotexts.sp.structure.usedropshadow.name: Use Drop Shadow
infotexts.sp.structure.dropshadowoffset.name: Drop Shadow Offset
infotexts.sp.structure.dropshadowoffset.descriptio: The position of the drop shadow relative to the structure. If set to zero, the shadow is positioned automatically so that it points toward the sub's center of mass.
infotexts.sp.structure.texturescale.name: Texture Scale
infotexts.sp.structure.textureoffset.name: Texture Offset
infotexts.sp.structure.removeiflinkedoutpostdoorin: Remove if linked outpost door is in use

If the structure is linked to a door at the edge of an outpost module, this setting will cause the structure to be removed if the door gets used in the outpost. Otherwise the structure is removed if the door is NOT used.
infotexts.sp.structure.noaitarget.name: No AI Target
infotexts.sp.structure.noaitarget.description: If enabled, monsters won't try to target this structure.
infotexts.sp.structure.maxhealth.name: Max Health
infotexts.sp.hull.ambientlight.name: Ambient Light
infotexts.sp.hull.roomname.name: Room Name
infotexts.sp.hull.iswetroom.name: Is Wet Room
infotexts.sp.hull.iswetroom.description: Is it normal for this hull to be filled with water? If the room name contains "ballast," "bilge," or "airlock," you can't disable this setting.
infotexts.sp.hull.avoidstaying.name: Avoid Staying
infotexts.sp.hull.avoidstaying.description: Bots avoid staying here, but they are still allowed to access the room when needed and go through it. Forced true for wet rooms.
infotexts.sp.door.openingspeed.name: Opening Speed
infotexts.sp.door.closingspeed.name: Closing Speed
infotexts.sp.door.togglecooldown.name: Toggle Cool Down
infotexts.sp.door.togglecooldown.description: The door cannot be opened/closed during this time after it has been opened/closed by another character.
infotexts.sp.door.isopen.name: Is Open
infotexts.sp.door.usebetweenoutpostmodules.name: Use Between Outpost Modules
infotexts.sp.door.usebetweenoutpostmodules.descrip: Is this a door that should lead to another outpost module? Only relevant for outpost modules.
infotexts.sp.door.botsshouldkeepopen.name: Bots Should Keep Open
infotexts.sp.door.botsshouldkeepopen.description: If true, bots won't try to close this door behind them.
infotexts.sp.itemcomponent.pickingtime.name: Picking Time
infotexts.sp.itemcomponent.pickingtime.description: How long it takes to pick up the item (in seconds).
infotexts.sp.itemcomponent.canbepicked.name: Can Be Picked
infotexts.sp.itemcomponent.canbepicked.description: Can the item be picked up (or interacted with, if the pick action does something other than picking up the item).
infotexts.sp.itemcomponent.allowingameediting.name: Allow In-Game Editing
infotexts.sp.itemcomponent.allowingameediting.desc: Can the properties of the component be edited in-game (only applicable if the component has in-game editable properties).
infotexts.sp.itemcomponent.msg.name: Msg
infotexts.sp.itemcomponent.msg.description: A text displayed next to the item when it's highlighted (generally instructs how to interact with the item, e.g. "[Mouse1] Pick up").
infotexts.sp.electricaldischarger.range.descriptio: How far the discharge can travel from the item.
infotexts.sp.electricaldischarger.rangemultiplieri: How much farther can the discharge be carried when moving across walls.
infotexts.sp.electricaldischarger.duration.name: Duration
infotexts.sp.electricaldischarger.duration.descrip: The duration of an individual discharge (in seconds).
infotexts.sp.electricaldischarger.outdoorsonly.des: If set to true, the discharge cannot travel inside the submarine or shock anyone inside.
infotexts.sp.electricaldischarger.reload.name: Reload
infotexts.sp.electricaldischarger.reload.descripti: How long it takes for the item to "reload" before it can discharge again (in seconds).
infotexts.sp.powered.minvoltage.name: Min Voltage
infotexts.sp.powered.minvoltage.description: The minimum voltage required for the device to function. The voltage is calculated as power/power consumption, meaning that a device with a power consumption of 1000 kW would need at least 500 kW of power to work if the minimum voltage is set to 0.5.
infotexts.sp.powered.powerconsumption.name: Power Consumption
infotexts.sp.powered.powerconsumption.description: How much power the device draws (or attempts to draw) from the electrical grid when active.
infotexts.sp.powered.vulnerabletoemp.name: Vulnerable to EMP
infotexts.sp.powered.vulnerabletoemp.description: Can the item be damaged by electromagnetic pulses?
infotexts.sp.entityspawnercomponent.itemidentifier: Identifier of the item to spawn; does nothing if SpeciesName is set. Separate by comma to have multiple items spawn at random.
infotexts.sp.entityspawnercomponent.speciesname.de: Species name of the creature to spawn; takes priority if ItemIdentifier is set. Separate by comma to have multiple creatures spawn at random.
infotexts.sp.entityspawnercomponent.onlyspawnwhenc: Only Spawn When Crew in Range
Only spawn if crew members are within a certain area
Shape of the area where crew members need to stay
infotexts.sp.entityspawnercomponent.crewareabounds: Size of the rectangle where crew members need to stay. Does nothing if CrewAreaShape is set to Circle
infotexts.sp.entityspawnercomponent.crewarearadius: Radius of the circle to spawn stuff in. Does nothing if CrewAreaShape is set to Rectangle
infotexts.sp.entityspawnercomponent.crewareaoffset: Offset of the crew area from the center of the item
infotexts.sp.entityspawnercomponent.spawnareashape: Shape of the area where enemies or items are spawned
infotexts.sp.entityspawnercomponent.spawnareabound: Size of the rectangle where items or creatures will be spawned. Does nothing if SpawnAreaShape is set to Circle
infotexts.sp.entityspawnercomponent.spawnarearadiu: Radius of the circle where items or creatures will be spawned. Does nothing if SpawnAreaShape is set to Rectangle
infotexts.sp.entityspawnercomponent.spawnareaoffse: Offset of the spawn area from the center of the item
infotexts.sp.entityspawnercomponent.spawntimerrang: Time range between spawn attempts in seconds. Set both to a negative value to disable automatic spawning.
infotexts.sp.entityspawnercomponent.spawnamountran: Minimum and maximum amount of items or creatures to spawn in one attempt
Total maximum amount of items or creatures that can be spawned. 0 = unrestricted.
infotexts.sp.entityspawnercomponent.maximumamounti: Amount of items or creatures in the spawn area that will prevent further items or creatures from being spawned. 0 = unrestricted.
infotexts.sp.entityspawnercomponent.maximumamountr: Inflate the circle or rectangle by this value to extend the area that counts toward the maximum amount of items or enemies to be spawned
infotexts.sp.entityspawnercomponent.preloadcharact: If the spawner spawns characters, should they be "pre-loaded" at the start of the round to avoid a lag spike when they spawn?
infotexts.sp.holdable.holdpos.name: Hold Pos
infotexts.sp.holdable.holdpos.description: The position the character holds the item at (in pixels, as an offset from the character's shoulder). For example, a value of 10,-100 would make the character hold the item 100 pixels below the shoulder and 10 pixels forward.
infotexts.sp.holdable.holdangle.name: Hold Angle
infotexts.sp.holdable.holdangle.description: The rotation at which the character holds the item (in degrees, relative to the rotation of the character's hand).
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingamount.name: Swing Amount
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingamount.description: How much the item swings around when aiming/holding it (in pixels, as an offset from AimPos/HoldPos).
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingspeed.name: Swing Speed
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingspeed.description: How fast the item swings around when aiming/holding it (only valid if SwingAmount is set).
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingwhenholding.name: Swing When Holding
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingwhenholding.description: Should the item swing around when it's being held.
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingwhenaiming.name: Swing When Aiming
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingwhenaiming.description: Should the item swing around when it's being aimed.
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingwhenusing.name: Swing When Using
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingwhenusing.description: Should the item swing around when it's being used (for example, when firing a weapon or operating a welding tool).
infotexts.sp.holdable.disableheadrotation.name: Disable Head Rotation
infotexts.sp.holdable.spritedepthwhendropped.name: Sprite Depth When Dropped
infotexts.sp.holdable.spritedepthwhendropped.descr: Sprite depth that's used when the item is NOT attached to a wall.
infotexts.sp.holdable.aimangle.name: Aim angle
infotexts.sp.holdable.aimangle.description: The angle at which the character holds the item while aiming (in degrees, relative to the rotation of the character's hand).
infotexts.sp.rangedweapon.penetration.name: Penetration
infotexts.sp.rangedweapon.penetration.description: Percentage of damage mitigation ignored when hitting armored body parts (deflecting limbs). Sum of weapon + projectile.
infotexts.sp.itemcontainer.containablerestrictions: Define items (by identifiers or tags) that bots should place inside this container. If empty, no restrictions are applied.
infotexts.sp.itemcontainer.autofill.name: Auto Fill
infotexts.sp.itemcontainer.autofill.description: Should this container be automatically filled with items?
infotexts.sp.itemlabel.text.name: Text
infotexts.sp.itemlabel.text.description: The text displayed in the label.
infotexts.sp.itemlabel.ignorelocalization.name: Ignore Localization
infotexts.sp.itemlabel.ignorelocalization.descript: Whether or not to skip localization and always display the raw value.
infotexts.sp.itemlabel.textcolor.description: The color of the text displayed on the label (R,G,B,A).
infotexts.sp.itemlabel.textscale.description: The scale of the text displayed on the label.
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.range.description: The range of the emitted light. Higher values are more performance intensive.
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.castshadows.name: Cast Shadows
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.castshadows.descriptio: Whether structures should cast shadows when light from this light source hits them. Disabling shadows increases the performance of the game, and is recommended for lights with a short range. Lights that are set to be drawn behind subs don't cast shadows, regardless of this setting.
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.drawbehindsubs.name: Draw Behind Subs
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.drawbehindsubs.descrip: Lights drawn behind submarines don't cast any shadows and are much faster to draw than shadow-casting lights. It's recommended to enable this on decorative lights outside the submarine's hull.
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.flicker.name: Flicker
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.flicker.description: How heavily the light flickers. 0 = no flickering, 1 = the light will alternate between completely dark and full brightness.
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.flickerspeed.name: Flicker Speed
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.pulsefrequency.name: Pulse Frequency
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.pulsefrequency.descrip: How rapidly the light pulsates (in Hz). 0 = no blinking.
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.pulseamount.name: Pulse Amount
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.pulseamount.descriptio: How much light pulsates (in Hz). 0 = not at all, 1 = alternates between full brightness and off.
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.blinkfrequency.name: Blink Frequency
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.blinkfrequency.descrip: How rapidly the light blinks on and off (in Hz). 0 = no blinking.
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.lightcolor.description: The color of the emitted light (R,G,B,A).
infotexts.sp.controller.istoggle.name: Is Toggle
infotexts.sp.controller.state.name: State
infotexts.sp.controller.state.description: Whether the item is toggled on/off. Only valid if IsToggle is set to true.
infotexts.sp.engine.maxforce.name: Max Force
infotexts.sp.engine.maxforce.description: The amount of force exerted on the submarine when the engine is operating at full power.
infotexts.sp.engine.propellerpos.name: Propeller Pos
infotexts.sp.engine.propellerpos.description: The position of the propeller as an offset from the item's center (in pixels). Determines where the particles spawn and the position that causes characters to take damage from the engine if the PropellerDamage is defined.
infotexts.sp.engine.disablepropellerdamage.name: Disable Propeller Damage
infotexts.sp.minimap.requirewaterdetectors.name: Require Water Detectors
infotexts.sp.minimap.requirewaterdetectors.descrip: Does the machine require inputs from water detectors in order to show the water levels inside rooms.
infotexts.sp.minimap.requireoxygendetectors.name: Require Oxygen Detectors
infotexts.sp.minimap.requireoxygendetectors.descri: Does the machine require inputs from oxygen detectors in order to show the oxygen levels inside rooms.
infotexts.sp.minimap.showhullintegrity.name: Show Hull Integrity
infotexts.sp.minimap.showhullintegrity.description: Should damaged walls be displayed by the machine.
infotexts.sp.minimap.enablehullstatus.name: Enable Hull Status
infotexts.sp.minimap.enableelectricalview.name: Enable Electrical View
infotexts.sp.minimap.enableitemfinder.name: Enable Item Finder
infotexts.sp.pump.maxflow.name: Max Flow
infotexts.sp.pump.maxflow.description: How fast the item pumps water in/out when operating at 100%.
infotexts.sp.reactor.maxpoweroutput.name: Max Power Output
infotexts.sp.reactor.maxpoweroutput.description: How much power (kW) the reactor generates when operating at full capacity.
infotexts.sp.reactor.meltdowndelay.name: Meltdown Delay
infotexts.sp.reactor.meltdowndelay.description: How long the temperature has to stay critical before a meltdown occurs.
infotexts.sp.reactor.firedelay.name: Fire Delay
infotexts.sp.reactor.firedelay.description: How long the temperature has to stay critical before the reactor catches fire.
infotexts.sp.reactor.fuelconsumptionrate.name: Fuel Consumption Rate
infotexts.sp.reactor.fuelconsumptionrate.descripti: How fast the condition of the contained fuel rods deteriorates per second.
infotexts.sp.sonar.usetransducers.name: Use Transducers
infotexts.sp.sonar.usetransducers.description: Does the sonar have to be connected to external transducers to work.
infotexts.sp.sonar.centerontransducers.name: Center on Transducers
infotexts.sp.sonar.centerontransducers.description: Should the sonar view be centered on the transducers or the submarine's center of mass. Only has an effect if UseTransducers is enabled.
infotexts.sp.sonar.hasmineralscanner.name: Has Mineral Scanner
infotexts.sp.sonar.hasmineralscanner.description: Does the sonar have mineral scanning mode.
infotexts.sp.steering.neutralballastlevel.name: Neutral Ballast Level
infotexts.sp.steering.neutralballastlevel.descript: How full the ballast tanks should be when the submarine is not being steered upwards/downwards. Can be used to compensate if the ballast tanks are too large/small relative to the size of the submarine.
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.maxoutput.name: Max Output
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.maxoutput.description: Maximum output of the device when fully charged (kW).
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.capacity.name: Capacity
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.capacity.description: The maximum capacity of the device (kW/min). For example, a value of 1000 means the device can output 100 kilowatts of power for 10 minutes, or 1000 kilowatts for 1 minute.
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.charge.description: The current charge of the device.
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.maxrechargespeed.name: Max Recharge Speed
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.maxrechargespeed.descr: How fast the device can be recharged. For example, a recharge speed of 100 kW and a capacity of 1000 kW/min would mean it takes 10 minutes to fully charge the device.
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.rechargespeed.name: Recharge Speed
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.rechargespeed.descript: The current recharge speed of the device.
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.efficiency.name: Efficiency
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.efficiency.description: The amount of power you can get out of an item relative to the amount of power that's put into it.
infotexts.sp.PowerContainer.FlipIndicator.name: Flip Indicator
infotexts.sp.PowerContainer.FlipIndicator.descript: Should the progress bar indicating the charge be flipped to fill from the other side.
infotexts.sp.powertransfer.canbeoverloaded.name: Can Be Overloaded
infotexts.sp.powertransfer.canbeoverloaded.descrip: Can the item be damaged if too much power is supplied to the power grid.
infotexts.sp.powertransfer.overloadvoltage.name: Overload Voltage
infotexts.sp.powertransfer.overloadvoltage.descrip: How much power has to be supplied to the grid relative to the load before the item starts taking damage. E.g., a value of 2 means that the grid has to be receiving twice as much power as the devices in the grid are consuming.
infotexts.sp.powertransfer.fireprobability.name: Fire Probability
infotexts.sp.powertransfer.fireprobability.descrip: The probability for a fire to start when the item breaks.
infotexts.sp.quality.qualitylevel.name: Quality Level
infotexts.sp.repairable.deteriorationspeed.name: Deterioration Speed
infotexts.sp.repairable.deteriorationspeed.descrip: How fast the condition of the item deteriorates per second.
infotexts.sp.repairable.mindeteriorationdelay.name: Min Deterioration Delay
infotexts.sp.repairable.mindeteriorationdelay.desc: Minimum initial delay before the item starts to deteriorate.
infotexts.sp.repairable.maxdeteriorationdelay.name: Max Deterioration Delay
infotexts.sp.repairable.maxdeteriorationdelay.desc: Maximum initial delay before the item starts to deteriorate.
The item won't deteriorate spontaneously if the condition is below this value. For example, if set to 10, the condition will spontaneously drop to 10 and then stop dropping (unless the item is damaged further by external factors). Percentages of max condition.
infotexts.sp.repairable.repairthreshold.name: Repair Threshold
infotexts.sp.repairable.repairthreshold.descriptio: The item's condition has to be below this before it becomes repairable. Percentages of max condition.
infotexts.sp.repairable.fixdurationlowskill.name: Fix Duration Low Skill
infotexts.sp.repairable.fixdurationlowskill.descri: The amount of time it takes to fix the item with insufficient skill levels.
infotexts.sp.repairable.fixdurationhighskill.name: Fix Duration High Skill
infotexts.sp.repairable.fixdurationhighskill.descr: The amount of time it takes to fix the item with sufficient skill levels.
infotexts.sp.repairtool.barrelrotation.name: Barrel Rotation
infotexts.sp.repairtool.barrelrotation.description: Rotation of the barrel in degrees.
infotexts.sp.buttonterminal.signals.name: Signals
infotexts.sp.buttonterminal.signals.description: Signals sent when the corresponding buttons are pressed.
infotexts.sp.buttonterminal.activatingitems.name: Activating Items
infotexts.sp.buttonterminal.activatingitems.descri: Identifiers or tags of items that, when contained, allow the terminal buttons to be used. Multiple ones should be separated by commas.
infotexts.sp.connectionpanel.locked.name: Locked
infotexts.sp.connectionpanel.locked.description: Locked connection panels cannot be rewired in-game.
infotexts.sp.memorycomponent.maxvaluelength.name: Max Value Length
infotexts.sp.memorycomponent.maxvaluelength.descri: The maximum length of the stored value. Warning: Large values can lead to high memory usage or networking issues.
infotexts.sp.memorycomponent.writeable.name: Writeable
infotexts.sp.memorycomponent.writeable.description: Can the value stored in the memory component be changed via signals.
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.ignoredead.name: Ignore Dead
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.ignoredead.description: Should the sensor ignore the bodies of dead characters?
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.detectoffset.name: Detect Offset
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.detectoffset.description: The position to detect movement at, relative to the item. For example, 0,100 would detect movement 100 units above the item.
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.updateinterval.name: Update Interval
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.updateinterval.descripti: How often the sensor checks if there's something moving near it. Higher values are better for performance.
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.output.description: The signal the item outputs when it has detected movement.
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.falseoutput.description: The signal the item outputs when it has not detected movement.
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.minimumvelocity.name: Minimum Velocity
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.minimumvelocity.descript: How fast objects within the detector's range have to be moving (in m/s) before they're detected.
infotexts.sp.terminal.welcomemessage.name: Welcome Message
infotexts.sp.terminal.welcomemessage.description: Message to be shown on the terminal display when it is first opened.
infotexts.sp.terminal.usemonospacefont.name: Use Monospace Font
infotexts.sp.terminal.usemonospacefont.description: The terminal will use a monospace font if this box is ticked.
infotexts.sp.textcolor.name: Text Color
infotexts.sp.terminal.linestartsymbol.name: Line start symbol
infotexts.sp.terminal.readonly.name: Read-only
infotexts.sp.range.name: Range
infotexts.sp.wificomponent.range.description: How close the recipient has to be to receive a signal from this wifi component.
infotexts.sp.wificomponent.allowcrossteamcommunica: Can the component communicate with wifi components in another team's submarine (e.g. enemy sub in Combat missions, respawn shuttle). Needs to be enabled on both the component transmitting the signal and the component receiving it.
infotexts.sp.wificomponent.linktochat.name: Link to Chat
infotexts.sp.wificomponent.linktochat.description: If enabled, any signals received from another chat-linked wifi component are displayed as chat messages in the chatbox of the player holding the item.
How many seconds have to pass between signals for a message to be displayed in the chatbox. Setting this to a very low value is not recommended, because it may cause an excessive amount of chat messages to be created if there are chat-linked wifi components that transmit a continuous signal.
infotexts.sp.wificomponent.discardduplicatechatmes: If set to true, the component will only create chat messages when the received signal changes.
infotexts.sp.wire.noautolock.name: No Auto Lock
infotexts.sp.wire.noautolock.description: If enabled, this wire will be ignored by the "Lock all default wires" setting.
infotexts.sp.wire.usespritedepth.name: Use Sprite Depth
infotexts.sp.wire.usespritedepth.description: If enabled, this wire will use the sprite depth instead of a constant depth.
infotexts.sp.triggercomponent.force.description: The maximum amount of force applied to the triggering entities.
infotexts.sp.triggercomponent.distancebasedforce.d: Determines if the force gets higher the closer the triggerer is to the center of the trigger.
infotexts.sp.triggercomponent.forcefluctuation.des: Determines if the force fluctuates over time or if it stays constant.
infotexts.sp.turret.hudtint.name: HUD Tint
infotexts.sp.turret.hudtint.description: Optional screen tint color when the item is being operated (R,G,B,A).
infotexts.sp.turret.reload.name: Reload
infotexts.sp.turret.reload.description: The period of time the user has to wait between shots.
infotexts.sp.turret.shotsperburst.name: Shots Per Burst
infotexts.sp.turret.shotsperburst.description: How many projectiles need to be fired before there's an extra break. (Think of the double coilgun.)
infotexts.sp.turret.delaybetweenbursts.name: Delay Between Bursts
infotexts.sp.turret.delaybetweenbursts.description: An extra delay between the bursts. Added to the reload.
infotexts.sp.turret.retractiondurationmultiplier.d: Modifies how long it takes for the barrel to get back to the original position after shooting. Reload time affects this, too.
infotexts.sp.turret.recoiltime.name: Recoil Time
infotexts.sp.turret.recoiltime.description: How quickly the recoil moves the barrel after launching.
infotexts.sp.turret.retractiondelay.name: Retraction Delay
infotexts.sp.turret.retractiondelay.description: How long the barrel stays in place after the recoil and before retracting back to the original position.
infotexts.sp.turret.rotationlimits.name: Rotation Limits
infotexts.sp.turret.rotationlimits.description: The range at which the barrel can rotate.
infotexts.sp.turret.springstiffnesslowskill.name: Spring Stiffness Low Skill
infotexts.sp.turret.springstiffnesslowskill.descri: How much torque is applied to rotate the barrel when the item is used by a character with insufficient skills to operate it. Higher values make the barrel rotate faster.
infotexts.sp.turret.springstiffnesshighskill.name: Spring Stiffness High Skill
infotexts.sp.turret.springstiffnesshighskill.descr: How much torque is applied to rotate the barrel when the item is used by a character with sufficient skills to operate it. Higher values make the barrel rotate faster.
infotexts.sp.turret.springdampinglowskill.name: Spring Damping Low Skill
infotexts.sp.turret.springdampinglowskill.descript: How much torque is applied to resist the movement of the barrel when the item is used by a character with insufficient skills to operate it. Higher values make the aiming more "snappy," stopping the barrel from swinging around the direction it's being aimed at.
infotexts.sp.turret.springdampinghighskill.name: Spring Damping High Skill
infotexts.sp.turret.springdampinghighskill.descrip: How much torque is applied to resist the movement of the barrel when the item is used by a character with sufficient skills to operate it. Higher values make the aiming more "snappy," stopping the barrel from swinging around the direction it's being aimed at.
infotexts.sp.turret.rotationspeedlowskill.name: Rotation Speed Low Skill
infotexts.sp.turret.rotationspeedlowskill.descript: Maximum angular velocity of the barrel when used by a character with insufficient skills to operate it.
infotexts.sp.turret.rotationspeedhighskill.name: Rotation Speed High Skill
infotexts.sp.turret.rotationspeedhighskill.descrip: Maximum angular velocity of the barrel when used by a character with sufficient skills to operate it.
infotexts.sp.turret.AutoOperate.name: Auto Operate
infotexts.sp.turret.AutoOperate.description: Should the turret operate automatically using AI targeting? Includes optional random movement settings that can be adjusted below.
infotexts.sp.turret.RandomAimAmount.name: Random Aim Amount
infotexts.sp.turret.RandomAimAmount.description: [Auto Operate] How much the turret should offset the aim randomly instead of tracking the target perfectly, in degrees.
infotexts.sp.turret.RandomAimMinTime.name: Random Aim Min Time
infotexts.sp.turret.RandomAimMinTime.description: [Auto Operate] How often the turret should adjust the aim randomly instead of tracking the target perfectly. Minimum wait time, in seconds.
infotexts.sp.turret.RandomAimMaxTime.name: Random Aim Max Time
infotexts.sp.turret.RandomAimMaxTime.description: [Auto Operate] How often the turret should adjust the aim randomly instead of tracking the target perfectly. Maximum wait time, in seconds.
infotexts.sp.turret.RandomMovement.name: Random Movement
infotexts.sp.turret.RandomMovement.description: [Auto Operate] Should the turret move randomly while idle?
infotexts.sp.turret.AimDelay.name: Aim Delay
infotexts.sp.turret.AimDelay.description: [Auto Operate] Should the turret have a delay while acquiring targets, or should it have perfect timing?
infotexts.sp.turret.TargetCharacters.name: Target Characters
infotexts.sp.turret.TargetCharacters.description: [Auto Operate] Should the turret target characters in general?
infotexts.sp.turret.TargetMonsters.name: Target Monsters
infotexts.sp.turret.TargetMonsters.description: [Auto Operate] Should the turret target all monsters?
infotexts.sp.turret.TargetHumans.name: Target Humans
infotexts.sp.turret.TargetHumans.description: [Auto Operate] Should the turret target all humans (or creatures in the same group, like pets)?
infotexts.sp.turret.TargetSubmarines.name: Target Submarines
infotexts.sp.turret.TargetSubmarines.description: [Auto Operate] Should the turret target other submarines?
infotexts.sp.turret.TargetItems.name: Target Items
infotexts.sp.turret.TargetItems.description: [Auto Operate] Should the turret target items?
infotexts.sp.turret.FriendlyTag.name: Friendly Tag
infotexts.sp.turret.FriendlyTag.description: [Auto Operate] Group or species name that the AI ignores when the turret is operated automatically.
infotexts.sp.dockingport.maindockingport.name: Main Docking Port
infotexts.sp.dockingport.maindockingport.descripti: If set to true, this docking port is used when spawning the submarine docked to an outpost (if possible).
infotexts.sp.dockingport.applyeffectsondocking.des: Should the OnUse StatusEffects trigger when docking (on vanilla docking ports these effects emit particles and play a sound).
infotexts.sp.dockingport.forcedockingdirection.des: Which direction the port is allowed to dock in. For example, "Top" would mean the port can dock to another port above it. Normally there's no need to touch this setting, but if you notice the docking position is incorrect (for example due to some unusual docking port configuration without hulls or doors), you can use this to enforce the direction.
infotexts.sp.meleeweapon.swing.name: Swing
infotexts.sp.meleeweapon.swingpos.name: Swing Pos
infotexts.sp.meleeweapon.swingforce.name: Swing Force
infotexts.sp.force.name: Force
infotexts.sp.propulsion.force.description: The force to apply to the user's body.
infotexts.sp.oxygengenerator.generatedamount.name: Generated Amount
infotexts.sp.oxygengenerator.generatedamount.descr: How much oxygen the machine generates when operating at full power.
infotexts.sp.booleanoperatorcomponent.output.descr: The signal sent when the condition is met.
The signal sent when the condition is met (if empty, no signal is sent).
infotexts.sp.concatcomponent.maxoutputlength.descr: The maximum length of the output string. Warning: Large values can lead to high memory usage or networking load.
infotexts.sp.delaycomponent.delay.description: How long the item delays the signals (in seconds).
infotexts.sp.delaycomponent.resetwhensignalreceive: Should the component discard previously received signals when a new one is received.
infotexts.sp.delaycomponent.resetwhendifferentsign: Should the component discard previously received signals when the incoming signal changes.
infotexts.sp.notcomponent.continuousoutput.name: Continuous Output
infotexts.sp.oscillatorcomponent.outputtype.descri: What kind of signal the item outputs. Pulse: periodically sends out a signal of 1. Sawtooth: sends out a periodic wave that increases linearly from 0 to 1. Sine: sends out a sine wave oscillating between -1 and 1. Square: sends out a signal that alternates between 0 and 1. Triangle: sends out a wave that alternates between increasing linearly from -1 to 1 and decreasing from 1 to -1.
infotexts.sp.oscillatorcomponent.frequency.name: Frequency
infotexts.sp.oscillatorcomponent.frequency.descrip: How fast the signal oscillates, or how fast the pulses are sent (in Hz).
infotexts.sp.regexfindcomponent.maxoutputlength.de: The maximum length of the output string. Warning: Large values can lead to large memory usage or networking issues.
infotexts.sp.relaycomponent.maxpower.name: Max Power
infotexts.sp.relaycomponent.maxpower.description: The maximum amount of power that can pass through the item.
infotexts.sp.greatercomponent.output.description: The signal sent when the first signal is larger than the second (if empty, no signal is sent).
infotexts.sp.greatercomponent.falseoutput.descript: The signal sent when the first signal is smaller than or equal to the second (if empty, no signal is sent).
infotexts.sp.ison.name: Is On
infotexts.sp.relaycomponent.ison.description: Can the relay currently pass power and signals through it.
infotexts.sp.signalcheckcomponent.output.descripti: The signal this item outputs when the received signal matches the target signal.
infotexts.sp.signalcheckcomponent.falseoutput.desc: The signal this item outputs when the received signal does not match the target signal.
infotexts.sp.signalcheckcomponent.targetsignal.des: The value to compare the received signals against.
infotexts.sp.maxoutputlength.name: Max Output Length
infotexts.sp.maxoutputlength.description: The maximum length of the output strings. Warning: Large values can lead to high memory usage or networking issues.
infotexts.sp.waterdetector.output.description: The signal the item sends out when it's underwater.
infotexts.sp.waterdetector.falseoutput.description: The signal the item sends out when it's not underwater.
infotexts.entitydescription.hull: Hulls determine which parts are considered to be "inside the sub." Generally every room should be enclosed by a hull.
infotexts.entitydescription.gap: Gaps allow water and air to flow between two hulls.
infotexts.entitydescription.waypoint: Used by AI characters to navigate inside the submarine.
infotexts.entitydescription.spawnpoint: Determines which rooms the crew members spawn inside.
infotexts.entityname.ff_x_wall_cables: Large Horizontal Inside Wall With Cables
infotexts.entityname.inwalll90cables: Large Vertical Inside Wall With Cables
infotexts.entitydescription.resizeablewallwithcoll: A resizable wall with collision detection.
infotexts.entitydescription.wallcap: A decorative structure intended to be placed at the ends or intersections of wall pieces.
infotexts.entitydescription.tailwithcollision: Submarine tail piece with collision detection.
infotexts.entitydescription.tailnocollision: Decorative submarine tail piece with no collision detection.
infotexts.entitydescription.frontwithcollision: Submarine front piece with collision detection.
infotexts.entitydescription.decorativestructure: A decorative structure with no collision detection.
infotexts.entitydescription.cableholder: Decorative strip for stowing wires neatly.
infotexts.entitydescription.platform: Walkable platform that a character can optionally drop down from or climb onto.
infotexts.eventeditor.newprojectprompt: Are you sure you want to create a new project? All unsaved changes will be lost.
infotexts.eventeditor.opentextbody: Do you want to open the exported event in a text editor?
infotexts.eventeditor.randomgenerationbody: This event was not created with the event editor and does not have node positions defined, so they have been automatically generated.
infotexts.leveleditor.levelobjnameempty: Please enter a name for the level object.
infotexts.leveleditor.levelobjnametaken: The selected name is already in use.
infotexts.leveleditor.levelobjtexturenotfound: Could not find the selected texture file.
infotexts.leveleditor.allowinvalidoutpost.tooltip: Should the outpost generator place an outpost that generated incorrectly (e.g. missing some required modules) instead of replacing it with a fallback outpost. Can be useful for debugging outpost generation.
